Startup Loop — How It Works

v3.12.0  ·  2026-02-23  ·  Layer A builds intelligence · Ideas pipeline surfaces what to build · Layer B implements it · MARKET + PRODUCTS+LOGISTICS now run in parallel from MEASURE exit

Who does what
🤖 Agent The agent handles this — you don't need to do anything
✍ You write You write this — the agent guides you
🤝 Both Agent does the work, you provide input or approve the result
Hard stop — cannot continue until this check passes
Advisory check — warns you but doesn't block
★ Standing doc Maintained continuously — feeds into the rest of the loop
🔍
Assessment — Understand Your Business & Brand
Steps 01–11 · Everything before you start researching the market
Steps 01–08 only needed if you're starting from a problem idea. If you already have a product, skip straight to Step 09.
Starting from a problem? Steps 01–08 apply. If you already have a product, skip to Step 09.
ASSESSMENT-01
Problem Framing
A clear written definition of the problem you're solving and who has it
🤖 Agent
ASSESSMENT-02
Solution-Space Scan
3 or more ways you could solve the problem, with notes on feasibility for each
🤖 Agent
ASSESSMENT-03
Solution Selection
Your chosen approach, with a written record of why the alternatives were ruled out
Decision required to continue — this is an explicit kill gate
🤖 Agent
ASSESSMENT-04
Candidate Names
A longlist of possible business names generated from your solution and audience
🤖 Agent
ASSESSMENT-05
Name Selection Spec
A structured brief for generating and scoring 250 name candidates (domain checks, trademark signals, brand fit)
🤖 Agent
ASSESSMENT-06
Distribution Profiling
Your launch channel plan — at least 2 channels with cost, effort, and why each fits your customer
🤖 Agent
ASSESSMENT-07
Measurement Profiling
Your tracking approach with at least 2 key metrics and the targets they need to hit
🤖 Agent
ASSESSMENT-08
Current Situation
A snapshot of where the business is today — what exists, what's missing, what the gaps are
🤖 Agent
STOP Current situation must be complete before continuing
✔ Pass: Current situation document is done and marked Active
ASSESSMENT-09 · Everyone starts here if skipping 01–08
Intake Check
Pulls together everything from steps 01–08 into a single intake packet the loop can work from
🤖 Agent
STOP All 8 earlier steps must be complete with sufficient detail
✔ Pass — all of the following complete:
  • Problem framing
  • Solution selection
  • Candidate names
  • Distribution plan (at least 2 launch channels)
  • Measurement plan (at least 2 metrics with targets)
  • Current situation
ASSESSMENT-10
Brand Profiling
Your brand strategy — who you're for, your personality, how you sound, how you're positioned vs competitors
🤖 Agent
ASSESSMENT-11
Brand Identity
Your visual identity — colour palette, typography choices, imagery direction, design token overrides
🤖 Agent
STOP Brand strategy and visual identity both complete
✔ Pass — both must be complete before market research begins:
  • Brand strategy (audience, personality, voice)
  • Visual identity (colours, type, imagery)
📊
Data Connections
Anchor your live problem framing from assessment, then get analytics in place before market research starts
MEASURE-00
Problem Framing & ICP
Your live problem statement and target customer segments — seeded from assessment, then kept current here as your understanding evolves
↓ Seeded once from assessment intake (ASSESSMENT-01 problem statement & ICP). Refresh directly here when framing changes or you pivot — not via assessment.
🤖 Agent★ Live doc
MEASURE-01
Analytics & Tracking Setup
Your full analytics stack is configured — GA4, Search Console, key conversion events, Consent Mode
You'll need about 30–60 minutes to grant access to Google Cloud, GA4, Cloudflare, and GitHub. The agent handles the configuration once you've done that.
↓ Seeded once from assessment intake (tracking method, key metrics & success thresholds from ASSESSMENT-07)
🤝 Both
MEASURE-02
Historical Performance Baseline
A record of past performance — traffic, revenue, conversion rates. Zeroes are fine for brand-new businesses.
🤖 Agent
⇆
Fan-out — three parallel streams from MEASURE exit
↓ Market intelligence (MARKET-01–05) ↓ Products & Logistics ⏳ SELL waits for MARKET-06 offer
Converges at MARKET-06
📈 Market Intelligence ‚Äî Runs in parallel
Core intelligence chain
MARKET-01
Competitor Mapping
A map of your competitors ‚Äî what they offer, their strengths, where they‚Äôre weak
‚Ü∫ Always reads current problem framing (MEASURE-00) ‚Äî if problem framing changes, re-run this stage
ü§ñ Agent
MARKET-02
Demand Evidence
Evidence that real demand exists ‚Äî search volume, social signals, marketplace data, with confidence ratings
ü§ñ Agent
MARKET-03
Pricing Benchmarks
Typical price ranges in your market, by competitor set
ü§ñ Agent
MARKET-04
Channel Landscape
Which sales channels work in your space, which don‚Äôt, and why
ü§ñ Agent
MARKET-05
Assumptions & Risk Register
What you‚Äôre assuming to be true, rated by risk ‚Äî so you know what to test first
ü§ñ Agent
📦 Product & Logistics Intelligence ‚Äî Runs in parallel
Product capture ‚Äî initial record
PRODUCT-01
Product From Photo
Your initial product record ‚Äî name, description, dimensions, materials, price point ‚Äî built from photos or descriptions you provide
‚Üì Seeded once from assessment intake (product definition, scope & constraints from ASSESSMENT-03)
ü§ù Both
Products ‚Äî build product intelligence
PRODUCTS-01
Product Line Mapping
A map of everything you sell, with positioning notes for each
‚Üì Seeded once from assessment intake (product definitions from ASSESSMENT-03)
ü§ñ Agent
PRODUCTS-02
Competitor Product Scan
What competitors sell and at what price points
‚Ü∫ Informed by MARKET-01 competitor map ‚Äî run after MARKET-01 where possible
‚á¶ Sync point ‚Äî wait for MARKET-01
ü§ñ Agent
PRODUCTS-03 ¬∑ Only once you have live sales data
Product Performance Baseline
Which products are selling and at what margins
ü§ñ Agent
PRODUCTS-04
Bundle & Packaging Hypotheses
Ideas for product bundles or packaging changes worth testing
‚Ü∫ Informed by MARKET-03 pricing benchmarks ‚Äî run after MARKET-03 where possible
‚á¶ Sync point ‚Äî wait for MARKET-03
ü§ñ Agent
PRODUCTS-05 ¬∑ Only once you have live sales data
Product-Market Fit Signals
Demand signals from reviews, returns, and repeat purchase patterns
ü§ñ Agent
PRODUCTS-06 ¬∑ Only once you have live sales data
Product Roadmap Snapshot
The key product decisions to make in the next 90 days
ü§ñ Agent
PRODUCTS-07
Aggregate Product Pack
A single summary of your full product intelligence ‚Äî the other parts of the loop read from this
ü§ñ Agent‚òÖ Standing docRefreshes every 90 days
Logistics ‚Äî conditional (physical products only)
Only for physical product businesses ‚Äî skip entirely if you don‚Äôt hold or ship stock
LOGISTICS-01
Supplier & Manufacturer Mapping
Your supplier list with minimum order quantities and lead times
ü§ñ Agent
LOGISTICS-02
Lead Times & MOQ Baseline
Consolidated stock constraints across all your SKUs
ü§ñ Agent
LOGISTICS-03
Fulfilment Options
3PL vs self-fulfilment vs dropship ‚Äî options and trade-offs
ü§ñ Agent
LOGISTICS-04
Cost & Margin by Route
The full cost stack for each fulfilment channel
ü§ñ Agent
LOGISTICS-05
Returns & Quality Baseline
Return rates and the most common quality failure modes
ü§ñ Agent
LOGISTICS-06
Inventory Policy Snapshot
Reorder points and safety stock targets for each SKU
ü§ñ Agent
LOGISTICS-07
Aggregate Logistics Pack
A single summary of your logistics intelligence ‚Äî the other parts of the loop read from this
ü§ñ Agent‚òÖ Standing docRefreshes every 90 days
💰 Sell ‚Äî Starts after MARKET-06
SELL ¬∑ Not yet active
Channel Strategy & Sales Intelligence
SELL stages (SELL-01 through SELL-08) begin after MARKET-06 Offer Design is complete. They open in the fan-out-1 section below.
↓ Unlocked by MARKET-06 ‚Äî scroll down to the fan-out section to see the SELL track in full
Why is SELL in a separate lane here?
Channel strategy cannot be finalised until you know your offer (MARKET-06). SELL-01 opens immediately after MARKET-06 in the fan-out below ‚Äî it runs in parallel with PRODUCT-02 adjacent research and Market intelligence deepening.
Converges at MARKET-06 — Offer Design
📈
Market — Offer Design
MARKET-06 · All three parallel streams converge here. Reads from MARKET-01–05 and PRODUCTS-07.
MARKET-06 · Triggers the parallel tracks below
Offer Design
Your complete offer — who it's for, what's included, how it's priced, your positioning vs competitors, and how you handle the most common objections
↺ Always reads brand strategy — use /lp-brand-refresh to update positioning or voice before re-running
🤖 Agent
STOP Brand messaging framework must exist before offer is finalised
✔ Pass: Your messaging hierarchy document (how you talk about your brand and products) is at least in draft
Two tracks run in parallel from here
Both must finish before the next step. Track 1 produces the required inputs for the baseline merge. Track 2 produces optional supporting intelligence.
Track 1 · Channel Strategy & Sales Intelligence
Channel strategy starts now
STOP Demand evidence minimum quality before channel strategy starts
✔ Pass — all must be present in your demand evidence:
  • At least 2 price variants documented
  • Customer objections captured
  • A speed-to-lead sample
SELL-01
Channel Strategy
Your top 2–3 launch channels with a 30-day action plan, plus SEO foundation and outreach templates
↓ Seeded once from assessment intake (planned channels from ASSESSMENT-06) and current problem framing (MEASURE-00)
🤖 AgentRequired at join
After channel strategy — ongoing sales intelligence
SELL-02
Channel Performance Baseline
How each channel is actually performing — conversion rate, cost to acquire, return on investment
🤖 Agent
SELL-03
Outreach & Content Standing
Your outreach cadence, content calendar, and engagement metrics
↺ Always reads brand strategy — use /lp-brand-refresh if voice or messaging direction changes
🤖 Agent
SELL-04
SEO Standing
Where you rank organically, keyword gaps, and backlink profile
🤖 Agent
SELL-05
Paid Channel Standing
Paid spend by channel, ROAS, and which creatives are showing fatigue
🤖 Agent
SELL-06
Partnerships & Referrals
Your partnership pipeline, referral programmes, and affiliate activity
🤖 Agent
SELL-07
Sell Aggregate Pack
A single summary of all your sales intelligence — the other parts of the loop read from this
🤖 Agent★ Standing docRefreshes every 90 days
↷ Only needed if you plan to run paid ads
SELL-08 · Only when paid spend is planned
Activation Readiness
Confirmation that you're ready to activate paid spend — does not block the main flow
🤖 Agent
STOP · Before any paid spend Tracking, risks, and conversion events all clear
All three must pass:
① Measurement is confirmed live and verified
② No critical or high-severity risks outstanding
③ Conversion events (checkout, add-to-cart) are firing in production
Track 2 · Adjacent Products (optional) + Market Intelligence Depth
PRODUCT-02 · Only if expanding your product range
Adjacent Product Research
Ideas for new products to add to your range — what customers also buy, what you could make
🤖 AgentOptional at join
ADVISORY Prompted when you've indicated plans to expand your range
⚠ Does not block anything — just kicks off the research automatically
Market intelligence deepens after offer is designed
MARKET-07
Post-Offer Synthesis
Market intelligence updated to reflect what you've now learned from designing your offer
🤖 Agent
MARKET-08
Demand Evidence Pack
All your demand signals compiled into a single reference document
🤖 Agent
MARKET-09
ICP Refinement
Your customer profile narrowed based on real demand signals and offer feedback
🤖 Agent
MARKET-10
Market Pack (Draft)
First consolidated draft of all market intelligence
🤖 Agent
MARKET-11
Market Pack (Validated)
Your finalised market intelligence summary — used across the rest of the loop
🤖 Agent★ Standing docRefreshes every 90 days
⊗
S4 — Bring Everything Together
All parallel tracks must finish before this step. The agent merges all inputs into a single baseline snapshot.
S4
Baseline Merge
A single merged snapshot of everything gathered so far — becomes the working baseline for the rest of the run
🤖 Agent
What gets brought together:
✔ Required · OfferYour complete offer design (from MARKET-06)
✔ Required · Channel StrategyYour launch channels and 30-day plan (from SELL-01)
○ Optional · SEO workFrom SELL-01 parallel output
○ Optional · Outreach templatesFrom SELL-01 parallel output
○ Optional · Adjacent product researchFrom PRODUCT-02, if run
○ Optional · Product intelligence packFrom PRODUCTS-07
○ Optional · Logistics packFrom LOGISTICS-07, if applicable
○ Optional · Market intelligence packFrom MARKET-11
S5A
Prioritise
The top 2–3 things to work on in this cycle, ranked and scored
🤖 Agent
S5B
System Sync
Commits the baseline and prioritised plan to the system record — this is the point of no return for the current run
🤖 Agent
WEBSITE-01
L1 First Build Framework
A framework-first assembly contract for the first website build: canonical sources, boundaries, route skeleton, and implementation order
🤖 Agent
WEBSITE-02
Site Upgrade Synthesis
A prioritised list of website improvements — pulled from competitor benchmarking, platform capabilities, and your brand spec
🤖 Agent
🔨
Implement — One Thing at a Time
Each cycle picks one idea from the Ideas pipeline and takes it through investigation → plan → build → review
Each cycle requires an idea card from the Ideas pipeline (or a direct inject with written rationale)
DO / 1
Fact-Find
Agent investigates what needs building and why — evidence, confidence scores, open questions
You'll review: an investigation brief before planning begins
🤝 Both
DO / 2
Plan
Agent breaks the work into tasks with estimates, dependencies, and confidence scores
You approve: the plan before any code is written
🤝 Both
DO / 3
Build
Agent implements the plan and records what was built, what was tested, and any deviations from the plan
🤖 Agent
DO / 4 · You write this
Results Review
What actually happened — outcomes observed, what you learned, any updates to standing intelligence, new ideas that emerged
The build cycle is not complete without this. Writing it feeds your learnings back into Layer A.
✍ You write
S9B · Pre-Launch
Pre-Launch QA Gates
Checks that conversion flows work, SEO is technically sound, performance is within budget, and legal requirements are met before going live
🤖 Agent
SIGNALS · Repeating weekly
Signals
Your weekly cycle — compile the numbers, make the K/P/C/S call, audit signal quality, read out experiments
SIGNALS-01
Revenue Forecast
P10 / P50 / P90 revenue scenarios for the next 90 days — refreshed each cycle as signals accumulate
🤖 Agent★ Refreshes each cycle
SIGNALS-02
Measure
Normalised KPI snapshot for the week — traffic, revenue, conversion rates, and denominator-valid metrics from live analytics
🤖 Agent
SIGNALS-03
Decide
K/P/C/S decision — what to Keep, Pivot, Cut, and Scale this week, anchored to the KPI snapshot
🤝 Both
SIGNALS-04
Signal Review
Audit signal quality for this run — top findings ranked by Severity × Support, with process-improvement stubs
🤖 Agent
SIGNALS-05
Experiments
Readout for active tests — completed experiments closed, next-cycle specs added, carry-forwards noted
🤖 Agent
ADVISORY Brand dossier freshness
⚠ Warning if your brand dossier hasn't been reviewed in more than 90 days — doesn't block anything
ADVISORY → STOP Bottleneck constraints
⚠ Advisory when a new constraint is flagged · becomes a hard block if the constraint is left unresolved — requires a replan before continuing
↺ SIGNALS repeats every week until the business exits the loop or starts a new run
spec v3.12.0 · 2026-02-23
Ideas Pipeline
IDEAS · Standing Pipeline
Runs on its own schedule — not part of the sequential flow · Layer A pack updates → Ideas backlog → Layer B implementation entry
Trigger A · Pack Update
A market, sell, products, or logistics intelligence pack is refreshed — the agent scans the diff automatically
automatic diff-scan
Trigger B · You inject an idea
You want to add an idea outside the normal refresh cycle — raise it directly
operator inject
Both triggers run through the same three stages.
Runs independently from the main loop — any number of cycles can be in flight at once.
IDEAS-01
Pack Diff Scan
A set of scan proposals — new ideas to create, existing ideas to strengthen or invalidate, ideas that should be merged or split
🤖 Agent
IDEAS-02
Backlog Update
The idea backlog is updated — new cards created, existing cards revised, weak ideas retired
Merge and split decisions require your confirmation before applying
🤝 Both
IDEAS-03
Promote to Implement
A ready idea is promoted into the implementation loop — it becomes the starting point for a DO cycle
Promotion requires: score ≥ 3, evidence quality Medium or higher
🤝 Both
🔨
Feeds into → Implement (DO · Layer B)
IDEAS-03 hands the idea off to the implementation loop — the DO cycle opens from there. Only promoted, scored ideas enter.
